definitions.definition: Any of a number of festivals held just before the beginning of Lent .
A festive occasion marked by parades and sometimes special foods and other entertainment .
A traveling amusement park , called a funfair in British English.
examples: We all got to ride the merry-go-round when they brought their carnival to town.
When the carnival came to town, every one wanted some cotton candy.

definitions.definition: A context in which transgression or inversion of the social order is given temporary license. Derived from the work of Mikhail Bakhtin .

main_definition: Any of a number of festivals held just before the beginning of Lent .
secondary_definitions: A festive occasion marked by parades and sometimes special foods and other entertainment .
( US ) A traveling amusement park , called a funfair in British English.
( sociology ) A context in which transgression or inversion of the social order is given temporary license. Derived from the work of Mikhail Bakhtin .
